intro: Galium scopolii, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, oval-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. It blooms from late spring to early summer, and its fruits are small, dry, and three-angled. Galium scopolii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
